meanings.definition: Having the shape of a rhombus.
meanings.sent1: The kite had a rhombic design on it.
meanings.sent2: The rhombic pattern on the floor tiles looked elegant.
meanings.sent3: The rhombic clouds in the sky seemed to form a giant diamond.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rhombic as the angles of a gemstone.
meanings.sent5: The rhombic shape of the garden pond shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a rhombus.
meanings.sent1: The artist used rhombic shapes in the painting to create a modern look.
meanings.sent2: The rhombic crystal structure of the mineral was fascinating to study.
meanings.sent3: The rhombic shadows cast by the streetlights made the road look like a giant game board.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a rhombic quality, sharp and precise.
meanings.sent5: The rhombic reflection of the sunset on the lake was breathtaking.
